definition: Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
incorruptible/honest/inexpensive/to investigate (old)/side wall of a traditional Chinese house (old)

sentences.english: The non-governmental organization has released its Corruption Perceptions Index each year since 1998 .
sentences.chinese: 自1998年起，該非政府組織每年公佈清廉指數。

sentences.english: Shabby clothes don't necessarily prove that you are free from corruption.
sentences.chinese: 冠帶襤褸不一定證明你是清廉的。

sentences.english: Incorruptible judges are the backbone of the society.
sentences.chinese: 清廉的法官是社會的基石。

sentences.english: Our government officials seem free of corruption.
sentences.chinese: 我們的政府官員似乎很清廉。

sentences.english: IT WAS a rare victory for fiscal rectitude.
sentences.chinese: 這是財政清廉的一個罕見的勝利。

sentences.english: My vision for India is a clean and corruption-free country.
sentences.chinese: 我對印度的願景是成爲一個乾淨和清廉的國家。

sentences.english: This reputation for incorruptibility is the greatest of our advantages in administering the Empire.
sentences.chinese: 清廉的名聲是我們統治管理帝國的最大優勢。

definition: self-restraint and devotion to public duties (idiom); selfless dedication/to serve the public interest wholeheartedly
to love the common people as one's own children (praise for a virtuous ruler)
lit. both sleeves flowing in the breeze (idiom); having clean hands/uncorrupted/unsoiled by corrupt practices
to secure a position/to take an official appointment
corruption and abuse of the law (idiom); to take bribes and bend the law
to take an official post/to become a government employee
to carry out official duties and observe the law
